meanings.definition: The act of describing the qualities or features of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the author's characterization of the main character made him seem brave and kind.
meanings.sent2: The characterization of the villain in the movie was so convincing that the audience booed every time he appeared on screen.
meanings.sent3: The funny characterization of the clumsy sidekick brought humor to the serious plot.
meanings.sent4: Her characterization of the city as a living, breathing entity added depth to her writing.
meanings.sent5: The vivid characterization of the haunted house made it feel like a character itself in the novel.

meanings.definition: The portrayal of a character in a story or play.
meanings.sent1: The actor's characterization of the evil queen was so convincing that the audience was scared of her.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the characterization of the hero as a brave warrior resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerated characterization of the clumsy waiter had the audience laughing throughout the performance.
meanings.sent4: His characterization of the city as a heartless beast reflected the harsh reality of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The memorable characterization of the wise old wizard left a lasting impression on the viewers.
